sen.j: 土御門 泰邦（つちみかど やすくに、正徳 (日本)元年8月8日 (旧暦)（1711年9月20日）－天明4年5月9日 (旧暦)（1784年6月26日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿・陰陽家。
sen.e: Yasukuni TSUCHIMIKADO (September 20, 1711 to June 26, 1784) was a high court noble and an Inyoka (the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) in the middle Edo period.
Yasukuni TSUCHIMIKADO (September 20, 1711 to June 26, 1784) was a high court noble and an Inyoka (the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) in the middle of the Edo period.
sen.cmt: 「江戸中期」＝in the middle of the Edo period
sen.e: Yasukuni TSUCHIMIKADO (September 20, 1711 to June 26, 1784) was a high court noble and an Inyoka (the Yin and Yang school of philosophy) in the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 土御門泰福の末子。
sen.e: He was the youngest child of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO.
He was the youngest child of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO.
He was the youngest child of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO.

sen.j: 兄土御門泰連の養子。
sen.e: He was the adopted child of his elder brother Yasutsura TSUCHIMIKADO.
He was the adopted child of his elder brother Yasutsura TSUCHIMIKADO.
He was the adopted child of his elder brother Yasutsura TSUCHIMIKADO.

sen.j: 土御門泰福の嫡男土御門泰誠は父に先立って病死。
sen.e: The legitimate son Yasumasa TSUCHIMIKADO of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO died of sickness before his father died.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The legitimate son Yasumasa TSUCHIMIKADO of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO died of sickness before his father died.
The legitimate son Yasumasa TSUCHIMIKADO of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO died of sickness before his father died.

sen.j: そのため、弟の泰連が泰誠の養子として家督を継ぐ。
sen.e: Therefore, younger brother Yasutsura succeeded to the head of the family as Yasumasa's adopted child.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, younger brother Yasutsura succeeded to the head of the family as Yasumasa's adopted child.
Therefore, younger brother Yasutsura succeeded to the head of the family as Yasumasa's adopted child.

sen.j: だが、子供に恵まれず末弟の泰邦を養子として迎える。
sen.e: However, he was not gifted with and child, so he received his youngest brother Yasukuni as an adopted child.
However, he had not been blessed with children, so he received his youngest brother Yasukuni as an adopted child.
sen.cmt: 「子どもに恵まれず」にあたる部分を改めました。
sen.e: However, he had not been blessed with children, so he received his youngest brother Yasukuni as an adopted child.

sen.j: 後に泰連には実子土御門泰兄が生まれる。
sen.e: Later, Yasutsura's own child Yasuani TSUCHIMIKADO was born.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Later, Yasutsura's own child Yasuani TSUCHIMIKADO was born.
Later, Yasutsura's own child Yasuani TSUCHIMIKADO was born.

sen.j: しかし、泰邦が泰兄を養子として後を継がせる事を条件に家督を継いだ。
sen.e: However, Yasukuni took over as head of the family with the condition that he received Yasuani as his adopted child to succeed after him.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, Yasukuni took over as head of the family with the condition that he received Yasuani as his adopted child to succeed after him.
However, Yasukuni took over as head of the family with the condition that he received Yasuani as his adopted child to succeed after him.

sen.j: （ただし、泰兄とその嫡男土御門有邦は泰邦より先に病死。
sen.e: (However, Yasuani and the heiress Yasukuni TSUCHIMIKADO died of sickness earlier than Yasukuni.
sen.cmt: 泰兄Yasuaniとしています。一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: (However, Yasuani and his legitimate son, Arikuni TSUCHIMIKADO died of sickness earlier than Yasukuni.
sen.cmt: heiress⇒legitimate son members2.jcom.home.ne.jp/.../tutimikadokesyou.htm に有邦=Arikuniとありました。
sen.e: (However, Yasuani and his legitimate son, Arikuni TSUCHIMIKADO died of sickness earlier than Yasukuni.

sen.j: 萩原家より有邦の養子に迎えられた土御門泰信も廃された。
sen.e: Yasunobu TSUCHIMIKADO, who was received as adopted child of Yuho from the HAGIWARA family, was abolished.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Yasunobu TSUCHIMIKADO, an adopted child of Arikuni from the HAGIWARA family, was abolished.
Yasunobu TSUCHIMIKADO, an adopted child of Arikuni from the HAGIWARA family, was abolished.

sen.j: 結局分家の倉橋家より泰信の養子として入った土御門泰栄（系譜上は泰邦玄孫）が泰邦の娘婿となり、その後継者となる）。
sen.e: After all, Taiei TSUCHIMIKADO, who was the adopted child of Yasunobu from the related Kurahashi family [great-great-grandson of Yasukuni on the genealogy], became the son-in-law of Yasukuni and became the successor.)
sen.cmt: 泰栄Taieiとしています。一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After all, Yasuhide TSUCHIMIKADO, who was the adopted child of Yasunobu from the related Kurahashi family [great-great-grandson of Yasukuni on the genealogy], became the son-in-law of Yasukuni and became the successor.)
sen.cmt: www.jidai-show.net/jdre0411.html に泰栄=やすひで とありました。
sen.e: After all, Yasuhide TSUCHIMIKADO, who was the adopted child of Yasunobu from the related Kurahashi family [great-great-grandson of Yasukuni on the genealogy], became the son-in-law of Yasukuni and became the successor.)

sen.j: 寛延3年（1750年）、引退した兄に代わって従三位となる。
sen.e: In 1750, he became Junior Third Rank in place of his elder brother who retired.
In 1750, he became Junior Third Rank in place of his elder brother who retired.
In 1750, he became Junior Third Rank in place of his elder brother who retired.

sen.j: 江戸幕府成立以来、幕府は朝廷より改元権限を実質上取り上げていた。
sen.e: Since the establishment of the Edo shogunate, the shogunate was taking up the authority of changing the name of the era from the court in reality.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Since the establishment of the Edo shogunate, the shogunate was taking up the authority of changing the name of the era from the court in reality.
Since the establishment of the Edo shogunate, the shogunate was taking up the authority of changing the name of the era from the court in reality.

sen.j: しかし、更に貞享暦制定の際に土御門泰福の配下として実務にあたった渋川春海を天文方に引き入れて改暦権限まで奪い取った。
sen.e: However, in addition, Harumi SHIBUKAWA, who hit the business as a subordinate of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO in the making of the Jokyo calendar, was enacted to astronomical elements and plundered even the authority of calendar amendment.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, in addition, the shogunate brought over Harumi SHIBUKAWA, who hit the business as a subordinate of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO in the making of the Jokyo calendar, to be a Tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy)and plundered even the authority of calendar amendment.
sen.cmt: 「引き入れて」の部分をはじめ、全体的に訳し直しました。
sen.e: However, in addition, the shogunate brought over Harumi SHIBUKAWA, who hit the business as a subordinate of Yasutomi TSUCHIMIKADO in the making of the Jokyo calendar, to be a Tenmonkata (officer in charge of astronomy)and plundered even the authority of calendar amendment.

sen.j: これを憂慮した泰邦は西村遠里ら在野の暦学者を保護して自分の傘下に入れていた。
sen.e: Yasukuni, who was worried about this, protected the calendar scholars such as Tosato NISHIMURA who were out of power, and put them in his subsidiary.
Yasukuni, who was worried about this, protected the calendar scholars such as Tosato NISHIMURA who were out of power, and put them under his wing.
sen.cmt: 「傘下に入れ」の部分を改めました。
sen.e: Yasukuni, who was worried about this, protected the calendar scholars such as Tosato NISHIMURA who were out of power, and put them under his wing.

sen.j: 折りしも、8代征夷大将軍徳川吉宗は、西洋天文学に基づいて新暦作成のために天文方の西川正休を京都に派遣した。
sen.e: Anyway, the 8th generation Barbarian Subduing General Yoshimune TOKUGAWA sent the astronomical scholar Masayoshi NISHIKAWA to Kyoto, in an attempt to make a new calendar based on the Western astronomy.

Anyway, the 8th generation Barbarian Subduing General Yoshimune TOKUGAWA sent the astronomical scholar Masayoshi NISHIKAWA to Kyoto, in an attempt to make a new calendar based on the Western astronomy.

Anyway, the 8th generation Barbarian Subduing General Yoshimune TOKUGAWA sent the astronomical scholar Masayoshi NISHIKAWA to Kyoto, in an attempt to make a new calendar based on the Western astronomy.

sen.j: ところが、その矢先に吉宗が病死し、幕府内部は改暦どころではなくなった。
sen.e: However at that time, Yoshimune died of sickness, and the inside of the shogunate became impossible to do the calendar amendment.
However at that time, Yoshimune died of sickness, and the inside of the shogunate became impossible to do the calendar amendment.
However at that time, Yoshimune died of sickness, and the inside of the shogunate became impossible to do the calendar amendment.

sen.j: そこで泰邦は西川らを京都から追放して自ら改暦を主導して宝暦4年（1754年）宝暦暦を作成して、翌年実施された。
sen.e: Then, Yasukuni banished Nishikawa from Kyoto, took the lead to make the calendar amendment, made the Horyaku calendar in 1754, and executed it the next year.
Then, Yasukuni banished Nishikawa from Kyoto, took the lead to make the calendar amendment, made the Horyaku calendar in 1754, and executed it the next year.
Then, Yasukuni banished Nishikawa from Kyoto, took the lead to make the calendar amendment, made the Horyaku calendar in 1754, and executed it the next year.

sen.j: この功績によって正二位治部卿にまで昇る。
sen.e: In view of this distinguished services, he was promoted up to Senior Second Rank Jibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Civil Administration).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In view of this distinguished services, he was promoted up to Senior Second Rank Jibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Civil Administration).
In view of this distinguished services, he was promoted up to Senior Second Rank Jibukyo (Minister of the Ministry of Civil Administration).

sen.j: しかし、宝暦暦施行からわずか8年後には麻田剛立や西村遠里によって日食予測の不備が指摘されるなど、問題が多かった。
sen.e: However after only eight years the Horyaku calendar enforcement, there were a lot of problems, such as the incompleteness of the solar eclipse forecast as pointed out by Goryu ASADA and Tosato NISHIMURA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However, the calender was problematic because only eight years after the enforcement, the incompleteness of the solar eclipse forecast was pointed out by Goryu ASADA, Tosato NISHIMURA and others.
sen.cmt: 文意から全体を訳し直しました。
sen.e: However, the calender was problematic because only eight years after the enforcement, the incompleteness of the solar eclipse forecast was pointed out by Goryu ASADA, Tosato NISHIMURA and others.

sen.j: 泰邦在世中の明和_(日本)8年（1771年）には早くも修正が加えられた。
sen.e: Even early in 1771 when Yasukuni was still alive in the world, corrections were added.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Even in 1771 when Yasukuni was still alive, corrections were already made.
sen.cmt: 「早くも」、「修正が加えられ」にあたる部分を改めました。
sen.e: Even in 1771 when Yasukuni was still alive, corrections were already made.

sen.j: 泰邦死後わずか13年にして再度寛政暦への改暦が行われる（寛政9年（1797年））ことになったのである。
sen.e: And only 13 years after Yasukuni's death, the calendar was restored back to Kansei calendar again (in 1797).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: And only 13 years after Yasukuni's death, the calendar was restored back to Kansei calendar again (in 1797).
And only 13 years after Yasukuni's death, the calendar was restored back to Kansei calendar again (in 1797).
